content.body: Eric Portis (he/him): it currently does, in https://github.com/annevk/orb/issues/30 I mention it as a possible fast path, but to match its processing model we'd have to track it across redirects
content.formatted_body: Eric Portis (he/him): it currently does, in https://github.com/annevk/orb/issues/30 I mention it as a possible fast path, but to match its processing model we'd have to track it across redirects

content.body: Eric Portis (he/him): I think if we do it properly (i.e., account for redirects) it's probably reasonable to safelist such responses

content.body: Let me repaste my original Libera question then
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Let me repaste my original Libera question then

content.body: are there any general guidelines regarding "js property <-> HTML attribute" reflection for custom elements?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: are there any general guidelines regarding "js property <-> HTML attribute" reflection for custom elements?

content.body: for instance those interactive components whose properties change quickly (`<my-map lat=... lon=...>`)
content.formatted_body: for instance those interactive components whose properties change quickly (<my-map lat=... lon=...>)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: for instance those interactive components whose properties change quickly (`<my-map lat=... lon=...>`)
for instance those interactive components whose properties change quickly (<my-map lat=... lon=...>)

content.body: I recall people suggesting to use attributes as the source of truth
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I recall people suggesting to use attributes as the source of truth

content.body: But that might not hold any more?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But that might not hold any more?

content.body: Might be a good question for #web-components:matrix.org though it's not very active. There's definitely no guidelines in the standard. I'd recommend looking at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/#reflect and seeing how it might be applicable for a custom element. At least if you want them to behave like built-in elements. Often that does use the attribute as a source of truth, but you could optimize around that a fair bit.
